text: My question of the week: I ve beeen playing a bit with deconvolution (Huygens) for light-sheet data (from MuVi spim and Lavision UMII); I then realized that both have lenses and pixels giving downsampling and making deconvolution quite inefficient; I then realized that just with a " background substraction" I can get very nice results(See picture)! Do you see any big drwabacks/hiddedn dangers in using this basic filtering? And if you have positive experience with light-sheet-deconvolution, maybe we can one day doscsuss about it..
